monitor log-profiles create.name: monitor log-profiles create

parameters.name: name
parameters.desc: The name of the log profile.

parameters.name: location
parameters.desc: Location. Values from: `az account list-locations`. You can configure the default location using `az configure --defaults location=<location>`.

parameters.name: categories
parameters.desc: Space-separated categories of the logs. These categories are created as is convenient to the user. Some values are: 'Write', 'Delete', and/or 'Action.'  Support shorthand-syntax, json-file and yaml-file. Try `??` to show more.

parameters.name: locations
parameters.desc: Space-separated list of regions for which Activity Log events should be stored.  Support shorthand-syntax, json-file and yaml-file. Try `??` to show more.

parameters.name: service_bus_rule_id
parameters.desc: The service bus rule ID of the service bus namespace in which you would like to have Event Hubs created for streaming the Activity Log. The rule ID is of the format: '{service bus resource ID}/authorizationrules/{key name}'.

parameters.name: storage_account_id
parameters.desc: the resource id of the storage account to which you would like to send the Activity Log.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.desc: Space-separated tags: key[=value] [key[=value] ...]. Use '' to clear existing tags.  Support shorthand-syntax, json-file and yaml-file. Try `??` to show more.

parameters.name: days
parameters.desc: the number of days for the retention in days. A value of 0 will retain the events indefinitely.

parameters.name: enabled
parameters.desc: Whether the retention policy is enabled.  Allowed values: false, true.

examples.name: Create a log profile. (autogenerated)
examples.text: az monitor log-profiles create --categories "Delete" --days 0 --enabled true --location westus2 --locations westus --name MyLogProfile --service-bus-rule-id "/subscriptions/{YOUR SUBSCRIPTION ID}/resourceGroups/{RESOURCE GROUP NAME}/providers/Microsoft.EventHub/namespaces/{EVENT HUB NAME SPACE}/authorizationrules/RootManageSharedAccessKey"

monitor log-profiles create.desc: Create a log profile in Azure Monitoring REST API.

parameters.name: name
parameters.desc: The name of the log profile.

monitor log-profiles update.name: monitor log-profiles update

parameters.name: generic_update_add
parameters.desc: Add an object to a list of objects by specifying a path and key value pairs.  Example: --add property.listProperty <key=value, string or JSON string>

parameters.name: generic_update_set
parameters.desc: Update an object by specifying a property path and value to set.  Example: --set property1.property2=<value>

parameters.name: generic_update_remove
parameters.desc: Remove a property or an element from a list.  Example: --remove property.list <indexToRemove> OR --remove propertyToRemove

parameters.name: generic_update_force_string
parameters.desc: When using 'set' or 'add', preserve string literals instead of attempting to convert to JSON.

parameters.desc: The name of the log profile.

parameters.name: service_bus_rule_id
parameters.desc: The service bus rule ID of the service bus namespace in which you would like to have Event Hubs created for streaming the Activity Log. The rule ID is of the format: '{service bus resource ID}/authorizationrules/{key name}'.

parameters.name: storage_account_id

monitor diagnostic-settings create.name: monitor diagnostic-settings create

parameters.name: name
parameters.desc: The name of the diagnostic setting. Required.

parameters.name: event_hub_rule
parameters.desc: Name or ID of the event hub authorization rule.

parameters.name: event_hub
parameters.desc: Name or ID an event hub. If none is specified, the default event hub will be selected.

parameters.name: logs
parameters.desc: JSON encoded list of logs settings. Use '@{file}' to load from a file.For more information, visit: https://docs.microsoft.com/rest/api/monitor/diagnosticsettings/createorupdate#logsettings.  Support shorthand-syntax, json-file and yaml-file. Try `??` to show more.

parameters.name: marketplace_partner_id
parameters.desc: The full ARM resource ID of the Marketplace resource to which you would like to send Diagnostic Logs.

parameters.name: metrics
parameters.desc: The list of metric settings.  Support shorthand-syntax, json-file and yaml-file. Try `??` to show more.

parameters.name: storage_account
parameters.desc: Name or ID of the storage account to send diagnostic logs to.

parameters.name: workspace
parameters.desc: Name or ID of the Log Analytics workspace to send diagnostic logs to.

parameters.name: resource
parameters.desc: Name or ID of the target resource.

parameters.name: resource_group_name
parameters.desc: Name of resource group. You can configure the default group using `az configure --defaults group=<name>`

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.desc: Target resource provider namespace.

parameters.name: parent
parameters.desc: Target resource parent path, if applicable.

parameters.name: resource_type
parameters.desc: Target resource type. Can also accept namespace/type format (Ex: 'Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines')

parameters.name: export_to_resource_specific
parameters.desc: Indicate that the export to LA must be done to a resource specific table, a.k.a. dedicated or fixed schema table, as opposed to the default dynamic schema table called AzureDiagnostics. This argument is effective only when the argument --workspace is also given.  Allowed values: false, true.

examples.name: Create diagnostic settings, retention here only applies when the target is a storage account.

monitor diagnostic-settings create.desc: Create diagnostic settings for the specified resource. For more information, visit: https://docs.microsoft.com/rest/api/monitor/diagnosticsettings/createorupdate#metricsettings.
